N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1160.17 - Guidelines for meet and greet services at Greater Buffalo International Airport

State Regulations

Guidelines, as listed below, are established by the Niagara

Frontier Transportation Authority (NFTA) for meet and greet services for the
expeditious movement of passengers through the terminal. (a) All commercial ground transportation
operators and companies providing ground transportation services may meet and
greet individuals or groups in the terminal only by the use of hand-held signs
and only in the specific area or areas designated by the airport manager for
meet and greet services. (b) Meet
and greet services must be conducted in a manner that does not obstruct the
normal flow of pedestrian traffic through the terminal. (c) The hand-held signs must have either the
name of the individual, group or company being met and must be of a
professional quality. (d) Individuals conducting meet and greet services may be required to provide the
airport manager or his designee certain pertinent information about the
individual or group being met (passenger's name, flight number, arrival time, etc.). Individuals conducting meet and greet services who are in violation of
these guidelines will be required to discontinue their meet and greet
activities immediately. Notes
